processed.result:
Given a prime number $m$ and a sequence of $n$ distinct integers $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$, determine if it is possible to rearrange the elements of the sequence to form an arithmetic progression modulo $m$. 

If it is possible, output the first element $x$ and the common difference $d$ of the arithmetic progression. Otherwise, output $-1$.

An arithmetic progression modulo $m$ of length $n$ with first element $x$ and difference $d$ is a sequence of integers: $x, x+d, x+2d, ..., x+(n-1)d$, where each element is taken modulo $m$.

Given a list of distinct numbers and a prime number, determine if the numbers can be rearranged to form an arithmetic sequence when all numbers are taken modulo the prime number. If possible, output the first number and the common difference of the sequence. Otherwise, output -1.
